result.execSummary:
The defendant Modesto Javier Melendez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Possession Of A Firearm By A Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a  DNA sample.
Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments including the DNA surcharges.  To be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC.  Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court sets restitution at zero.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 3 years.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 2.  Credit for 141 days time served.

Not to reside or be present where illgeal drugs are present in any building and or vehicle.
Not to reside or be present where firearms are present in any vehicle.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from fiearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote  until civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 1.  Credit for 141 days time served.

charges.descr: Possession Of A  Firearm By A Felon

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Modesto Javier Melendez

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of victim notification.
Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1 and 2.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 9 YEARS, concurrent to count 2, credit for 141 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 4 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 8 YEARS, concurrent to count 1, credit for 141 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 4 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Not to reside or be present where illegal drugs are present in any building and or vehicle.
- Not to reside or be present where firearms are present in any vehicle.

- Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 


*Court sets restitution at zero.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AFTER SERVING 3 YEARS
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, 
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. State placed final offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 4.
Notice of Alibi
Defendant's Motion in Limine (Prior Criminal Record)
Defendant's Motion in Limine (Prior Acts Regarding Ashley Rodriguez)
General Motion in Limine
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Modesto Javier Melendez not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  All previously ordered bond conditions remain.  Case adjourned to Branch 04.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Modesto Javier Melendez not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises does not have victim notification to proceed with bail hearing. Speedy trial entered on 6-22-2022 with expiration date of 9-20-2022.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in court, appear by video with attorney Richard L. Voss. appear by video.  Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judical Notice to case 15CF663. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective G. Fraley.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bail.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Modesto Javier Melendez not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel. Defense has now been appointed by the PD's office. Court finds good cause for the extension of prelim hearing due to reasons stated on the record. Case set for prelim heaing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed.

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez not in court, defendant in custody.  Greg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-Lee hearing in the trial court  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Modesto J. Melendez, House of Correction - L6/33, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Motion for Discovery.  (Modesto J. Melendez - #2022003780, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Motion for 90 Day Speedy Trial.  (Modesto J. Melendez - #2022003780, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with J.D.V ; J.M.B-R ; A.J.R-D
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Modesto Javier Melendez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant hemay qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
